value.title: Help your Power BI report users with an Information Panel
value.excerpt: Do your Power BI users understand your report? Chances are, at least not all of it. Help them out with an information panel to help describe the report and understand all of the capabilities. Adam walks you through how to do it in Power BI Desktop!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yYr_SlG8bpw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Make your Power BI report POP with a custom background
value.excerpt: Is your report plain or bland? Patrick shows you how you can easily make your Power BI report pop with a custom background. It's as easy as just getting PowerPoint and drawing some shapes.  Demo files: https://guyinacu.be/demofiles  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Populate a Power BI parameter list using a query
value.excerpt: Patrick shows you how to populate a Power BI parameter list using a query. This can help you avoid manually entering a list, or just having free text.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI report page tooltip - How to create one in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Patrick walks through what a Power BI report page tooltip is and how to create one in Power BI Desktop. This is a feature that was added to Power BI Desktop in the March 2018 release.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Refresh and NO DATA in my Power BI visuals???
value.excerpt: Have you published your Power BI report to the service, refresh the data, and the visuals go blank? Patrick may have an answer for you. value.title: Use your browser to edit your Power BI dataset within Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: More Power BI Desktop capabilities are heading to the service. Modeling in the web is the latest addition. Now Mac users can enjoy editing capabilities! Emily joins us to tell us more!  Edit your data model in the Power BI Service (Preview) https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/edit-your-data-model-in-the-power-bi-service-public-preview-opt-in/

value.title: Why can't Power BI connect to my cloud source???
value.excerpt: You have a cloud data source like Azure SQL Database. Why can't Power BI connect to it? They are both in the cloud! Adam shows you some things to consider and options you have! value.title: How to Do Power BI Mapping With Latitude and Longitude Only
value.excerpt: You can just use latitude and longitude to visualize data on the map. In this video, you will learn how you can do that with the map visual in Power BI. Read more and download the dataset from my blog article link here: https://radacad.com/how-to-do-power-bi-mapping-with-latitude-and-longitude-only

value.title: Set Power BI Data Color   All Visuals to Follow Same Color for the Same Data Point
value.excerpt: You can set the color in every visual in Power BI easily. You can also set the color of multiple visuals at the same time using Themes. However, what if you want to set the same color for the same data point? For example, You want the Gender Female to be always colored Orange in all the charts and visuals.

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Creating a slicer that filters multiple columns in Power BI

value.title: Use Apache Spark in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Apache Spark is a core technology for large-scale data analytics. Microsoft Fabric provides support for Spark clusters, enabling you to analyze and process data at scale.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Avoid refresh errors when importing files in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you refreshed Power BI files and got errors due to missing columns or unwanted columns? Here I show you how to avoid new columns for getting added and refresh error from missing columns.  I learnt this by watching Microsoft Power BI webinar with Chris Webb: https://info.microsoft.com/CO-PowerBI-WBNR-FY16-06Jun-21-Amazing-Things-with-Power-BI-Registration.html?Is=Website

value.title: Concatenate/ Merge columns with Power Query, the right way.
value.excerpt: Concatenating columns in Power Query is not hard to do, but depending on the technique you use, you might get unexpected or wrong results.  There is a bullet proof way to do it and I will explain it here.  Link to the null, blank video mentioned in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EoRjNx1G2g4

value.title: Enable QUERY FOLDING for native queries in Power Query / Power BI

value.title: Looking at Power BI Many to Many
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick takes a look at Power BI Many to Many relationships. This was part of the July 2018 Power BI Desktop release and can enable some awesome capabilities. Patrick looks at why you may not want to use Power BI Many to Many even though you think you do.  Many to Many documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-many-to-many-relationships
